intro: Alopecurus alpinus subsp. pseudobrachystachyus, commonly known as the alpine hairgrass, is a perennial grass species native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as alpine meadows and rocky slopes. The plant has slender,丛生 stems with small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its inflorescence consists of compact, spike-like clusters of tiny flowers, which are wind-pollinated. This subspecies is adapted to cold climates and is often found at high altitudes where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
